headline.main: N. ROOSEVELT NAMED ENVOY TO HUNGARY; Resigned as Vice Governor of the Philippines Because of Native Protests. WITHDRAWAL COMMENDED Hoover Reviews Nominee's Service in Europe and Familiarity With Opportunities of New Post. Appreciates Unselfish Spirit. Text of Roosevelt's Letter. Complains of Misrepresentation. Services of New Minister Reviewed. Nomination Caused Controversy. Filipinos Hail Resignation.

headline.main: 33 COUNTRIES SENT US GOLD LAST MONTH; Total Import Was $19,714,221 --France Took $35,309,272 of Our $39,331,864.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Sept. 27.--The Uruguayan Government has begun taking precautionary measures against a revolution, which has been rumored brewing for several weeks.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Sept. 27.--The Uruguayan Government has begun taking precautionary measures against a revolution, which has been rumored brewing for several weeks.

headline.main: URUGUAY PREPARES AGAINST A REVOLT; Troops Held in Readiness in Barracks and Arms Are Sent to Police Stations. ALARM IN COUNTRY RISES Business Unites to Fight Proposed Minimum Wage and Pension Laws --Deficits Charged.

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Sept. 27.--The Cuban cruiser Cuba left here at 10 o'clock tonight for Key West, Fla., to await the arrival there at 6 o'clock tomorrow of $25,000,000 to be sent from the Federal Reserve Bank at Atlanta, Ga., consigned to Director of Posts...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Sept. 27.--The Cuban cruiser Cuba left here at 10 o'clock tonight for Key West, Fla., to await the arrival there at 6 o'clock tomorrow of $25,000,000 to be sent from the Federal Reserve Bank at Atlanta, Ga., consigned to Director of Posts Montalvo of Havana.

headline.main: RUN ON CUBAN BANKS AFTER ONE CLOSES; Cruiser on Way to Key West, Fla., to Get $25,000,000 to Reassure Depositors Monday. RUN ON CUBAN BANKS AFTER ONE CLOSES

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: COINCIDENTAL with the gathering last week of 100 repre  sentatives of the aircraft and air transport industry of the United States in Washington to talk over proposed additions and changes in the air commerce regulations, and especially the...
docs.lead_paragraph: COINCIDENTAL with the gathering last week of 100 repre sentatives of the aircraft and air transport industry of the United States in Washington to talk over proposed additions and changes in the air commerce regulations, and especially the air-worthiness requirements, Major Clarence M. Young, Assistant Secretary of Commerce for Aeronautics, warned against overregulation by the States.

headline.main: SEEK NEW RULES FOR AIR SAFETY; Department of Commerce and Aircraft Makers Discuss Stricter Requirements for Planes--Major Young Stresses Uniform Laws Air-Worthiness Debated. Seek Better Visibility.
